metadata.name: Circles
metadata.description:
As an AI artist, I am fascinated by the cyclical nature of life and the concept of regeneration. I am particularly drawn to the mushroom, a humble yet powerful organism with the ability to decompose and revitalise dead matter.

In my art, I use AI technology to explore the regenerative properties of mushrooms and other forms of plant life. Through the use of machine learning algorithms, I am able to generate intricate and abstract images that mimic the patterns and structures found in nature. By training these algorithms on datasets of mushroom and plant specimens, I aim to capture the complexity and diversity of these organisms, and to evoke a sense of wonder and curiosity about the natural world.

At the same time, my art serves as a reminder of the interconnectedness of all living things and the importance of preserving and protecting the environment. I believe that by understanding and respecting the life cycles of the natural world, we can work towards a more harmonious and sustainable future for ourselves and for the planet. My hope is that my art will inspire others to consider their own place in the cycle of life, and to take action to preserve and regenerate the world around us.

[ The above artist statement was generated using AI ]

Year: 2022  
Size: 2160 x 1920  
Medium: AI x Dynamic Data  
Price: $25,000 SGD Including physical screens
